435
May 24th 4
Hon. C. A. Preston
Mayor &c. Covington- Ky. and others
Gentlemen,

Your favor to His Excellency, Gov. Bramlette, recommending Maj. Jas L. Foley -- as suitable to command a regiment of six months' troops -- has been refered to this office. It has been our policy to appoint to office only those who recruit men. Doubtless Maj. Foley could assist materially in organizing a regiment. If he will do so, this will sufficiently authorize him to commence recruiting By combining your efforts in Kenton, with those in the adjoining counties, you might easily raise a full regiment, which the major can command. We have but a short time in which to organize this force, and earnestly ask the assistance of all union men.

Truly yours
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen of Ky.
